metadata.subject: Re: Fw: WaPo story-- Trump's outside counsel

relationships.description: Journalist seeking comment from potential legal counsel
Potential legal counsel for President Trump
News organization reporting on White House legal matters

analysis.purpose: Journalist seeking comment and background information about Reid Weingarten being considered as outside counsel for President Trump
analysis.significance: Documents media inquiry about Trump administration's legal staffing decisions during early presidency

notable_quotes: I'm emailing because my colleague, Bob Costa, and I getting ready to post a story about President Trump's decision to move ahead with retaining outside counsel, and we understand you're one of the finalists for the role
I also wanted to check and see if you were open to chatting totally off the record, just in case there is any nuance or guidance you'd like to provide

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present - standard professional media inquiry

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is a routine media inquiry email

details: Washington Post journalist Ashley Parker seeking comment about Trump's outside counsel selection
Story being prepared by Ashley Parker and Bob Costa

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be routine media coverage of Trump administration staffing decisions, which was widely reported during early presidency

analysis.summary: Washington Post journalist Ashley Parker emails Reid Weingarten to inform him they are publishing a story about President Trump retaining outside counsel and that Weingarten is a finalist for the role, seeking comment and potential off-the-record guidance.
